Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Class to implement Camera to render the picture
Author:
Yona and Hillel

    java.util.List<Ray> construct4RaysThroughPixel​(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)

    java.util.List<Ray> construct5RaysFromRay​(Ray myRay, double nX, double nY)
    Function that gets a pixel's center ray and constructs a list of 5 rays from that ray, one at each corner of the pixel and one in the center

    Construct ray through nthe center of a pixel when we have only the bottom right corner's ray

    This function get a ray launched from the camera of a pixel and launch others rays from all the aperture of the camera in direction of the point on the depth of field plane

    This function get a ray launched in the center of a pixel and launch a beam n * m others rays on the same pixel

    • moveCamera

      public void moveCamera​(double up, double right, double to)
      Move camera (move point of view of the camera)
      Parameters:
      up - Vertical distance
      right - Horizontal side distance
      to - Horizontal to distance

    • rotateCamera

      public void rotateCamera​(Vector axis, double theta)
      Rotate camera through axis and angle of rotation
      Parameters:
      axis - Axis of rotation
      theta - Angle of rotation (degrees)

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, double j, double i)
      The function constructs a ray from Camera location through the center of a pixel (i,j) in the view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in a row of view plane
      nY - number of pixels in a column of view plane
      j - number of the pixel in a row
      i - number of the pixel in a column
      Returns:
      the ray through pixel's center

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      private Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int m, int n, double j, double i, double pixelH, double pixelW, Point3D pc)
      The function constructs a ray from Camera location through a point (i,j) on the grid of a pixel in the view plane
      Parameters:
      m - grid's height
      n - grid's width
      j - number of the pixel in the row
      i - number of the pixel in the column
      pixelH - height of the pixel
      pixelW - width of the pixel
      pc - pixel center
      Returns:
      the ray through pixel's center

    • constructRaysGridFromRay

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRaysGridFromRay​(int nX, int nY, int n, int m, Ray ray)
      This function get a ray launched in the center of a pixel and launch a beam n * m others rays on the same pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in a row of view plane
      nY - number of pixels in a column of view plane
      n - number of the rays to launch in pixel
      m - number of the ray to launch in the pixel
      ray - the ray that it is already launched in the center of the pixel
      Returns:
      list of rays when every ray is launched inside a pixel with random emplacement

    • constructRaysGridFromCamera

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRaysGridFromCamera​(int n, int m, Ray ray)
      This function get a ray launched from the camera of a pixel and launch others rays from all the aperture of the camera in direction of the point on the depth of field plane
      Parameters:
      n - height of the grid
      m - width of the grid
      ray - the ray that it is already launched from the camera
      Returns:
      list of rays when every ray is launched from the grid inside a pixel with random emplacement

    • constructRayFromPixel

      private Ray constructRayFromPixel​(int nX, int nY, double j, double i, double pixelSize, Point3D point)
      This function returns a ray from a point in the aperture circle
      Parameters:
      nX - grid's width
      nY - grid's height
      j - y emplacement of the point
      i - x emplacement of the point
      pixelSize - size of side of the pixel on the grid
      point - point on the depth of field plane
      Returns:
      a ray to the point on the depth of field plane

    • construct5RaysFromRay

      public java.util.List<Ray> construct5RaysFromRay​(Ray myRay, double nX, double nY)
      Function that gets a pixel's center ray and constructs a list of 5 rays from that ray, one at each corner of the pixel and one in the center
      Parameters:
      myRay - the center's ray
      nX - number of pixel in width
      nY - number of pixels in height
      Returns:
      list of rays

    • construct4RaysThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> construct4RaysThroughPixel​(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)
      Function that returns a list of 4 rays in a pixel one on the top upper the center point one on the left of the center one on the right of the center one on the bottom of the center
      Parameters:
      ray - the center's ray
      nX - number of pixel in width
      nY - number of pixels in height
      Returns:
      list of rays

    • constructPixelCenterRay

      public Ray constructPixelCenterRay​(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)
      Construct ray through nthe center of a pixel when we have only the bottom right corner's ray
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray
      nX - number of pixel in width
      nY - number of pixels in height
      Returns:
      center's ray

    • getPointOnViewPlane

      private Point3D getPointOnViewPlane​(Ray ray)
      Function to find a specific point on the plane we need to calculate the distance from the point on the camera to the plane for that we use the cos of the angle of the direction ray with vTo vector
      Parameters:
      ray - ray to the specific point
      Returns:
      the distance to the point
